properties.abstract: This is a tour across several summits to La Berra, a first-class viewpoint. Formerly it was also called Birrenberg. There is an invisible line separating the French speaking from the German speaking part of Switzerland, the "Röstigraben" ("Rösti ditch"), and it goes right through La Berra.
properties.subtitle: From Röstigraben to spa
properties.title: Plasselb – Le Cousimbert – La Berra – Charmey

sac_photos.title: Le Gros Cousimbert - Jura in the background
View from La Berra to Le Cousimbert
Looking back at la Berra from the variant to Schwarzsee
Gîte d'Allières; Vanil des Cours in the background
The direct descent to the Gîte d'Allières

segments.description:
At Plasselb descend south-westward to the Ärgera. Before the bridge (815 m) turn left to follow the creek into Plasselbschlund. Cross the next bridge, follow the road for a short while, then branch off to a trail on the left-hand side. It follows the Ärgera and finally turns northward to cross the road through the gorge. The hiking trail continues northward in pastures and through the forest and past the Birbaumli hut to reach the ridge and finally Chrüzflue (1263 m), an unobtrusive summit. 

Continue south-westward, at first through the forest, then in pastures to reach Buvette Crau-Rappo (ca. 1305 m) and a road. Leave the road as soon as you can to reach the ridge. Follow the trail on the ridge. Further up you exit the forest and continue on the hiking trail past the mountain restaurant at Gros Cousimbert (1571 m) to reach the summit cross at Le Cousimbert/Käsenberg (1632 m).
segments.title: Plasselb – Chrüzflue – Le Cousimbert / Käsenberg

segments.description: From the Le Stoutz bus stop on the southern edge of La Roche follow the road towards the village until the hiking trail branches off to the right. Ascend steeply through the forest to Sur le Bey and the road giving access to the La Berra skiing area. Follow the road to the holiday homes at Montsoflo, then take the hiking trail to Le Brand (ca. 1040 m, unnamed on the map), the bottom station of the ski-lifts. Follow the hiking trail via Le Cousimbert à Remy to reach the grassy ridge. Follow it to the summit cross on Käsenberg / Le Cousimbert (1632 m); La Roche – Le Cousimbert/ Käsenberg: 2¾ h.

photos.caption: Summer in the skiing area La Berra

photo.image_usage: Plasselb – Le Cousimbert – La Berra – Charmey

segments.title: Variant 1: ascent to Le Cousimbert / Käsenberg from La Roche

segments.description: There is a marked hiking trail on the ridge via Supiletta (1584 m) to Buvette La Berra and directly up to La Berra (1719 m). You can descend on the ascent route back to Buvette La Berra and continue on a wide trail southward to Gîte d’Allières. However, there is a shortcut: pathless, descend south-westward on the grassy summit slope to reach the forest edge. Traverse the forest to the wide trail on the west face. On this trail continue to descend to Gîte d’Allières (1485 m).
segments.title: Le Cousimbert / Käsenberg – La Berra – Gîte d'Allières

segments.description: Switch from the «Broc-Fabrique – Vanil des Cours» tour: from Vanil des Cours descend northward to La Guille (1269 m) and past the La Chia knoll (ca. 1364 m) to reach a col (P. 1334 m). The hiking trail to La Berra goes north-eastward via Le Solitou (1381 m) to reach another col (1376 m). Now leave the hiking trail to take a path on the ridge. Follow this path, at first in the forest, then along the forest edge to reach Mont aux Oies (P. 1474, unnamed on the map). In the pasture descend south-eastward to reach the hiking trail, which you meet, where it disappears in the forest. It descends to a saddle (ca. 1429 m), traverses a knoll (P. 1456) and finally ends at Gîte d’Allières (1485 m) close to La Berra; T1-T2, Vanil des Cours – Gîte d'Allières ca. 2 h.

photos.caption: View from Gîte d'Allières to Vanil des Cours

photo.image_usage: Plasselb – Le Cousimbert – La Berra – Charmey

segments.title: Variant 2: access to Gîte d'Allières from Vanil des Cours

segments.description:
The descent from Gîte d’Allières follows the south ridge until ca. 1270 m, where the trail turns sharply left to reach P. 1239 on the road. Follow the road, then a trail to La Cierne. From there go eastward to the La Valsainte monastery (1015 m). It is the only Carthusian monastery in Switzerland (closed to the public). 

Pass the monastery on the east, cross Le Javro (965 m) and ascend to the road. For a short while follow the road, then the trail on the hillside to Les Ciernes. From here do not follow the hiking route on the left-hand side, but the road straight ahead to the St-Jean chapel and the Bains de la Gruyère of Charmey (open daily all year round). There are two bus stops nearby: Village and Corbettaz.
segments.title: Gîte d’Allières – La Valsainte – Charmey

segments.description: Descend on the hiking trail from Gîte d’Allières via La Berguerite and La Maule to the Le Stoutz bus stop at La Roche; Gîte d’Allières – La Roche ca.1½ h.
segments.title: Variant 3: descent from Gîte d'Allières to La Roche

segments.description: From La Berra follow the ridge to the east which in constant ups and downs goes across La Berra Est (1688 m, summit cross, unnamed on the map) and Parc des Fayes (ca. 1572 m, unnamed on the map) and finally bypasses a nameless knoll to reach the L‘Auta Chia d’Amont mountain restaurant (1456 m, also spelled „Hauta Chia“). Ascend to La Patta (1616 m) on its west ridge, then descend to the saddle at P.1487. Re-ascend to the south summit of Schwyberg (1627 m). Now descend either pathless via P. 1595 and the south-east ridge to reach the hiking trail, which leads from Guglervorsass to Schwarzsee Bad, or across Güger to Schwarzsee Gypsera; T1-T2, Gîte d'Allières - La Patta - Schwyberg Süd - Schwarzsee Bad ca. 3¼ h.

photos.caption: Past Breccaschlund the route goes to Schwarzsee.

photo.image_usage: Plasselb – Le Cousimbert – La Berra – Charmey
Plasselb – Le Cousimbert – La Berra – Charmey

photos.caption: View from P.1688 to Kaiseregg and Breccaschlund

segments.title: Variante 4: descent from La Berra to Schwarzsee Bad
